comments.body:
[~jpommer] Just tested out the latest pushed code and it's looking good! A couple of things I noticed: When I clicked the create launch config button from the Security section, it took me to the Advanced section instead, but that section should be optional. It should have just created my launch config. 

Also when I clicked the create launch config button from the advanced section it didn't seem to do anything. That's not hooked up yet, I guess?

Almost there! Keep plugging!

Jenny,

Button navigation sorted out. The wizard backend code needed a little massaging to get the 'next' and 'finish' buttons working as expected. I've also closed the circuit with the launchconfig.js model and am sending the request to create when you click that button. I just get a null back, and the red error banner on my machine - probably because it's using mock data. I've updated Ean and asked him to push this last set of changes so you can take it for a spin.

Thanks, Jerry! I'll try it out this morning.

Tim, wanted to be sure you were aware of the change to the wizard
controller code and that it needs to operate the same anywhere there are
"advanced" options...just FYI.

Thanks,

J.Lo


On Sun, Apr 7, 2013 at 1:42 AM, Jerry Pommer (JIRA) <




-- 

*_________________________*



*Jenny Loza - *Principal User Experience Architect

*Eucalyptus Systems*

www.eucalyptus.com

+1 512-496-1236



Follow us on Twitter <http://www.twitter.com/eucalyptus>

Like our Facebook
Page<http://www.facebook.com/pages/Eucalyptus-Systems-Inc/164828240204708>

Keep up-to-date with
us<http://go.eucalyptus.com/Sign-Up-for-Cloud-Computing-News.html?Offer=Other&OfferDetails=Sign%20Up%20for%20Cloud%20Computing%20News&LeadSourceDetails=Eucalyptus%20Website&OfferURL=http%3A%2F%2Fgo.eucalyptus.com%2FSign-Up-for-Cloud-Computing-News.html>

*_________________________*

magic search bar not filtering on description (please check to be sure it's filtering correctly on other facets also). Selected image's name not displaying in summary area. I have an image selected but when i click Next:type it says I don't. Adding screenshots so you can see. Can't check any further because I can't get past the images subsection. This work is lower priority than launch instance wizard so please don't work on it until that is done.
adding screenshots to show latest problems i am seeing with launch config wizard.

Jenny,

Confirmed image selection problem - there was a collision with changes from elsewhere that only manifested itself once merged. Sorted.

Confirmed search bar facets not working. Looking at those now.

Jenny,

Wizards seem to be working fine now, with the exception of the search bars. They're presently broken site-wide, it appears. I'll ask Ean to push tomorrow.

Jenny,

Hold the phone. There were some changes from elsewhere that I didn't get merged into my working branch that caused the image selection problem. NOW I see what you see. Will fix.

Jenny,

The source of the problem was located and fixes are in place. Additionally I revisited the wireframe for the new instance wizard this morning and saw a note added about the storage editor not being included in the next release. I can remove it for now. Be advised, it is complete and functional to the point of sending drive mapping data to the server, but the server does not appear to honor it... at least there is no indication in the response that the requested volumes have been created and united with the resulting instance. If that can be sorted out the thing can be considered functionally complete.

I've added the 'tags' step to that wizard as well and have a tag editor in it. Working out the last few bugs with getting the tags created on the server and attached to the new instances, and should have that done today.

YAY!

Go ahead and leave the storage stuff in for now. Maybe we can get it fixed.
If not we can always pull it out.

Are your latest fixes pushed to Ean so he can push them to our team branch?
We need those asap, even if the tag creation isn't quite working yet, so we
can do regression testing. Ean, as soon as you have Jerry's stuff can you
push to team please?

Thanks! This is great news.

J.Lo


On Wed, Apr 17, 2013 at 10:36 AM, Jerry Pommer (JIRA) <




-- 

*_________________________*



*Jenny Loza - *Principal User Experience Architect

*Eucalyptus Systems*

www.eucalyptus.com

+1 512-496-1236



Follow us on Twitter <http://www.twitter.com/eucalyptus>

Like our Facebook

*_________________________*

Jenny,

I just committed:

1) the tooltip fixes
2) filtering out kernels and ramdisks from the image selector
3) jump to the appropriate landing page on wizard completion
4) new instance wizard availability zone pulldown not getting dynamic zone data (reported by Alice in irc yesterday)
5) User data submission via the textarea

Continuing to work on replacing the summary checboxes with icons
Getting the help icon situated
Collaborating with Ean on the tag editor
Userdata file upload

awesome, thank you! a few more things alice found:

1) Create keypair link doesn't pop up the modal box for creating a key pair. the key pair should then  be selected in the dropdown after you have created it.
2) number of instances should be prepopulated with "1"
3) security group dropdown is not showing the name of the security group.

[quote]
1) Create keypair link doesn't pop up the modal box for creating a key pair. the key pair should then be selected in the dropdown after you have created it.
2) number of instances should be prepopulated with "1"
3) security group dropdown is not showing the name of the security group. 
[/quote]

1 - I get the modal box in my checkout. I'll work with Ean to make sure there are no weird differences between my branch and team. Selector update after a new keypair is created - will fix.
2 - Will fix.
3 - Do you mean after a new one is created in the modal box? Will fix.
hi [~jpommer] for #3 the dropdown is actually showing the contents of the security group description field. It should be showing the contents of the security group name field.
Oh, got it. Fixed.

hi [~jpommer] checking latest push, Name field should not be required but instance size should be.

Create key pair seems to pop up the modal but the key pair isn't in the list after i created it. should be in the list and selected.

Next: Advanced should not be a button. It is a link in the old wizard, under the launch instance button.  

I see a few texty things that need tweaking but you are pulling strings from messages.properties, right? If so, I can just go in there and tweak the strings. 

Thanks! Getting there...

Jenny,

Okay, un-requiring the name field, requiring the instance size. While we're on that subject, is it okay for the instance size to default to the first choice, or should it be empty with "Select and instance size..." or something?

Yes, those key/sgroup dialogs aren't working. Looking at those right now.

Advanced button vs. link: hmm... Tim's wizard code makes that somewhat impractical, as all wizard steps, including Advanced options, are treated the same. Let me see what I can do about it.

*Most* strings are from Messages.properties. There are a few that don't exist in there yet. I can get you a list of those.

The instance size should remember the last one selected and default to that. For the first time, we have traditionally gone with m1.small. 

Ean has fixed the create key pair in the past, you might have overwritten a fix he did (although, getting the created key pair to show up in the combobox was still not fixed). He is currently working ont he create security group dialog, so you should coordinate with him to pull in his latest stuff. 

See what you can do about the advanced thing being a link rather than a button. That's important.

Jenny,

Clarification, please? Should it remember the last instance size selected *for this session*, or from whatever the last run was, whenever it was (yesterday, last week, last year)?

Yes, I'll check in with Ean in the morning on these dialogs.
Good morning! Last run, please. Save it in a cookie or something.

Link vs. button for advanced options step resolved. Ean has fixed the sgroup and keypair dialogs. Tag editor is functional and moved back into the Type step.

Remaining:

Add "None" option to keypair selector.
Store last selected instance type for later auto-select.

still not seeing BDM options under advanced when BFEBS image selected, and also name is required but the wizard lets me skip past that without entering one. When I went back to that section by clicking on the mini-ribbon section header, the Create Launch Configuration button was showing even though I was in the Type section and it doesn't belong there. See attached screenshot.
Fixed BDM regression and required name check.

Fixed the appearance of the create button in step two - only displays in step 3 and 4 like it should. All of the above available in:

team/console/3.3.1

commit 0cc6475e51f69a0c11ace1d8a873f2bf367983af
Author: Jerry Pommer <jpommer@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 2 16:59:12 2013 -0500

Sorry, I saw a couple minor things still. Key Name and Security Group are required fields but they don't have the red asterisk in the labels. Also, the piece of general text that says "*Required fields" is missing from the wizard.

Pushed to team/console/EUCA-5166. I noticed that we're also missing the "Create scaling group using this launch configuration" option at the bottom. Should this create a scaling group straight away as best it can, or should it take you to the scaling group wizard that Ean is working on?
Pushed to team/console/3.3.1 as well.
The "Create scaling group using this launch configuration" option should take you to the scaling group wizard [~eans] is working on, with the launch config pre-selected.

Just added the last bit - the 'Create scaling group using this launch configuration' option, which will take you right to the scaling group wizard with the new launch config name preloaded. 

Pushed to team/console/3.3.1
